Playbook.html.title: Playbook
Playbook.html.body:
Playbook
The central scenario manager.
open class Playbook

You can use the singleton default or use it
with instantiate arbitrarily.
struct Content: View {
    var body: some View {
        Text("Playbook")
    }
}

Playbook.default.addScenarios(of: "Components") {
    Scenario("Content", layout: .compressed) {
        Content()
    }
}
Initializers
init()
Initialize a new Playbook.
public init()

Properties
`default`
The default shared instance of Playbook.
let `default` = Playbook()

stores
A set of stores that holds the added scenarios.
var stores: [ScenarioStore]

Methods
scenarios(of:)
Returns a store identified by specified kind.
public func scenarios(of kind: ScenarioKind) -> ScenarioStore

If there is no store yet, add and return it.
Parameters

kind: An unique identifier that stores a set of scenarios.

Returns
A store identified by specified kind.
add(_:)
Adds a set scenarios defined in specified provider.
@discardableResult public func add(_ provider: Provider.Type) -> Self

Parameters

provider: A type of provider that provides a set of scenarios.

Returns
A instance of self.
addScenarios(of:_:)
Adds a set of scenarios passed by function builder.
@discardableResult public func addScenarios(of kind: ScenarioKind, _ scenarios: () -> S) -> Self

Parameters

kind: An unique identifier that stores a set of scenarios.
scenarios: A function builder that create a set of scenarios.

Returns
A instance of self.
run(_:_:)
Serialy runs specified tests conform to TestTool protocol.
public func run(_ test: TestTool, _ tests: TestTool) throws

Parameters

test: The first test to be run.
tests: The trailing tests to be run in order.

PlaybookCatalog.html.title: PlaybookCatalog
PlaybookCatalog.html.body:
PlaybookCatalog
A view that displays scenarios manged by given Playbook instance with
catalog-style appearance.
public struct PlaybookCatalog: View

Inheritance
View
Initializers
init(name:playbook:)
Creates a new view that displays scenarios managed by given Playbook instance.
public init(name: String = "PLAYBOOK", playbook: Playbook = .default)

Parameters

name: A name of Playbook to be displayed on the user interface.
playbook: A Playbook instance that manages scenarios to be displayed.

Properties
body
Declares the content and behavior of this view.
var body: some View

PlaybookGallery.html.title: PlaybookGallery
PlaybookGallery.html.body:
PlaybookGallery
A view that displays scenarios manged by given Playbook instance with
gallery-style appearance.
public struct PlaybookGallery: View

Inheritance
View
Initializers
init(name:playbook:preSnapshotCountLimit:snapshotColorScheme:)
Creates a new view that displays scenarios managed by given Playbook instance.
public init(name: String = "PLAYBOOK", playbook: Playbook = .default, preSnapshotCountLimit: Int = 100, snapshotColorScheme: ColorScheme = .light)


Note: If the displaying of this view is heavy, you can delay the generation of the snapshot image for preview by lowering preSnapshotCountLimit.

Parameters

name: A name of Playbook to be displayed on the user interface.
playbook: A Playbook instance that manages scenarios to be displayed.
preSnapshotCountLimit: The limit on the number of snapshot images for preview that can be generated before being displayed.
snapshotColorScheme: The color scheme of the snapshot image for preview.

Properties
body
Declares the content and behavior of this view.
var body: some View

Scenario.html.title: Scenario
Scenario.html.body:
Scenario
Represents part of the component state.
public struct Scenario

Inheritance
ScenariosBuildable
Initializers
init(_:layout:file:line:content:)
Creates a new scenario.
public init(_ name: ScenarioName, layout: ScenarioLayout, file: StaticString = #file, line: UInt = #line, content: @escaping (ScenarioContext) -> ScenarioContent)

Parameters

name: An unique name of this scenario.
layout: Represents how the component should be laid out.
file: A file path where defined this scenario.
line: A line number where defined this scenario in file.
content: A closure that make a new content with passed context.

init(_:layout:file:line:content:)
Creates a new scenario.
public init(_ name: ScenarioName, layout: ScenarioLayout, file: StaticString = #file, line: UInt = #line, content: @escaping () -> ScenarioContent)

Parameters

name: An unique name of this scenario.
layout: Represents how the component should be laid out.
file: A file path where defined this scenario.
line: A line number where defined this scenario in file.
content: A closure that make a new content.

init(_:layout:file:line:content:)
init(_:layout:file:line:content:)
Properties
name
An unique name of scenario that describes component and its state.
var name: ScenarioName

layout
Represents how the component should be laid out.
var layout: ScenarioLayout

file
A file path where defined this scenario.
var file: StaticString

line
A line number where defined this scenario in file.
var line: UInt

content
A closure that make a new content with passed context.
var content: (ScenarioContext) -> ScenarioContent

Methods
buildScenarios()
Builds an array of scenarios containing only self.
public func buildScenarios() -> [Scenario]

ScenarioLayout.html.title: ScenarioLayout
ScenarioLayout.html.body:
ScenarioLayout
Represents how the component should be laid out.
public struct ScenarioLayout: Equatable

Inheritance
Equatable
Nested Types

ScenarioLayout.Sizing

Properties
h
A horizontal sizing strategy.
var h: Sizing

v
A vertical sizing strategy.
var v: Sizing

compressed
Compresses both the horizontal and vertical to the intrinsic size of the component.
let compressed = ScenarioLayout(h: .compressed, v: .compressed)

fill
Fill both the horizontal and vertical to the size of the canvas on
which to layout the component.
let fill = ScenarioLayout(h: .fill, v: .fill)

fillH
Fill the horizontal to the size of the canvas on which to layout the component
and compresses the vertical to the intrinsic size of the component.
let fillH = ScenarioLayout(h: .fill, v: .compressed)

fillV
Fill the vetical to the size of the canvas on which to layout the component
and compresses the horizontal to the intrinsic size of the component.
let fillV = ScenarioLayout(h: .compressed, v: .fill)

Methods
fixed(width:height:)
Layout both the vertical and horizontal with given fixed width and height.
public static func fixed(width: CGFloat, height: CGFloat) -> ScenarioLayout

Note: There are cases that to compressed to
the size of the canvas on which to layout it when it can't be displayed
on the user interface.
fixed(length:)
Layout both the vertical and horizontal with given fixed length.
public static func fixed(length: CGFloat) -> ScenarioLayout

Note: There are cases that to compressed to
the size of the canvas on which to layout it when it can't be displayed
on the user interface.
fixedH(_:)
Layout the horizontal with given fixed width and compresses the vertical
to the intrinsic size of the component.
public static func fixedH(_ width: CGFloat) -> ScenarioLayout

Note: There are cases that to compressed to
the size of the canvas on which to layout it when it can't be displayed
on the user interface.
fixedV(_:)
Layout the vertical with given fixed height and compresses the horizontal
to the intrinsic size of the component.
public static func fixedV(_ height: CGFloat) -> ScenarioLayout

Note: There are cases that to compressed to
the size of the canvas on which to layout it when it can't be displayed
on the user interface.
sizing(h:v:)
Layout the vertical and horizontal sizes according to the specified strategies.
public static func sizing(h: Sizing, v: Sizing) -> ScenarioLayout

Parameters

h: A horizontal sizing strategy.
v: A vertical sizing strategy.

ScenarioLayout_Sizing.html.title: ScenarioLayout.Sizing
ScenarioLayout_Sizing.html.body:
ScenarioLayout.Sizing
A sizing strategy for the horizontal or vertical dimensions.
public enum Sizing

Inheritance
Equatable, ExpressibleByIntegerLiteral, ExpressibleByFloatLiteral
Enumeration Cases
compressed
Compresses to the intrinsic size of the component.
case compressed

fill
Fill to the size of the canvas on which to layout the component.
case fill

fixed
Layout with given fixed size.
Note: There are cases that to compressed to
the size of the canvas on which to layout it when it can't be displayed
on the UI.
case fixed(: CGFloat)

Initializers
init(integerLiteral:)
Creates a fixed sizing with the specified value converted to a CGFloat.
public init(integerLiteral value: Int)

Parameters

value: The actual value of fixed sizing.

init(floatLiteral:)
Creates a fixed sizing with the specified value converted to a CGFloat.
public init(floatLiteral value: Float)

Parameters

value: The actual value of fixed sizing.

Snapshot.html.title: Snapshot
Snapshot.html.body:
Snapshot
The testing tool which generates snapshot images from scenarios managed by Playbook.
public struct Snapshot: TestTool

Inheritance
TestTool
Nested Types

Snapshot.Context
Snapshot.ExportMethod

Enumeration Cases
file
case file(directory: URL, clean: Bool, format: SnapshotSupport.ImageFormat)

data
case data(format: SnapshotSupport.ImageFormat, handler: (Context) -> Void)

image
case image(handler: (Context) -> Void)

Initializers
init(directory:clean:format:timeout:scale:keyWindow:devices:)
Creates a new snapshot tool for export all image files into specified directory.
public init(directory: URL, clean: Bool = false, format: SnapshotSupport.ImageFormat, timeout: TimeInterval = 600, scale: CGFloat = UIScreen.main.scale, keyWindow: UIWindow? = nil, devices: [SnapshotDevice])

Parameters

directory: A base directory for exporting snapshot image files.
clean: Specifies whether that to clean directory before generating snapshots.
format: An image file format of exported data.
timeout: A timeout interval until the finish snapshot of all scenarios.
scale: A rendering scale of the snapshot image.
keyWindow: The key window of the application.
devices: A set of snapshot environment simulating devices.

init(format:timeout:scale:keyWindow:devices:handler:)
Creates a new snapshot tool for handles generated image data with closure.
public init(format: SnapshotSupport.ImageFormat, timeout: TimeInterval = 600, scale: CGFloat = UIScreen.main.scale, keyWindow: UIWindow? = nil, devices: [SnapshotDevice], handler: @escaping (Context) -> Void)

Parameters

format: An image file format of exported data.
timeout: A timeout interval until the finish snapshot of all scenarios.
scale: A rendering scale of the snapshot image.
keyWindow: The key window of the application.
devices: A set of snapshot environment simulating devices.
handler: A closure that to handle generated data.

init(timeout:scale:keyWindow:devices:handler:)
Creates a new snapshot tool for handles generated UIImage with closure.
public init(timeout: TimeInterval = 600, scale: CGFloat = UIScreen.main.scale, keyWindow: UIWindow? = nil, devices: [SnapshotDevice], handler: @escaping (Context) -> Void)

Parameters

timeout: A timeout interval until the finish snapshot of all scenarios.
scale: A rendering scale of the snapshot image.
keyWindow: The key window of the application.
devices: A set of snapshot environment simulating devices.
handler: A closure that to handle generated UIImage.

Properties
timeout
A timeout interval until the finish snapshot of all scenarios.
var timeout: TimeInterval

scale
A rendering scale of the snapshot image.
var scale: CGFloat

keyWindow
The key window of the application.
var keyWindow: UIWindow?

devices
A set of snapshot environment simulating devices.
var devices: [SnapshotDevice]

Methods
run(with:)
Generates snapshot images for passed Playbook instance.
public func run(with playbook: Playbook) throws

Parameters

playbook: A Playbook instance to be tested.

The device representation for simulating environments of each device such as

traitCollection: A simulated trait collection.

SnapshotSupport.html.title: SnapshotSupport
SnapshotSupport.html.body:
SnapshotSupport
A namespace for the methods supporting to generate snapshot from scenarios.
public enum SnapshotSupport

Nested Types

SnapshotSupport.ImageFormat
SnapshotSupport.Resource

Methods
data(for:on:format:scale:keyWindow:handler:)
Generates an image file data that snapshots the given scenario.
public static func data(for scenario: Scenario, on device: SnapshotDevice, format: ImageFormat, scale: CGFloat = UIScreen.main.scale, keyWindow: UIWindow? = nil, handler: @escaping (Data) -> Void)


Note: Passing the key window adds the scenario content to the view hierarchy and actually renders it, so producing a more accurate snapshot image.

Parameters

scenario: A scenario to be snapshot.
device: A snapshot environment simulating device.
format: An image file format of exported data.
scale: A rendering scale of the snapshot image.
keyWindow: The key window of the application.
handler: A closure that to handle generated data.

image(for:on:scale:keyWindow:handler:)
Generates an UIImage that snapshots the given scenario.
public static func image(for scenario: Scenario, on device: SnapshotDevice, scale: CGFloat = UIScreen.main.scale, keyWindow: UIWindow? = nil, handler: @escaping (UIImage) -> Void)


Note: Passing the key window adds the scenario content to the view hierarchy and actually renders it, so producing a more accurate snapshot image.

Parameters

scenario: A scenario to be snapshot.
device: A snapshot environment simulating device.
scale: A rendering scale of the snapshot image.
keyWindow: The key window of the application.
handler: A closure that to handle generated UIImage.

A file extension string for the image file exported by this image format.

SnapshotWaiter.html.title: SnapshotWaiter
SnapshotWaiter.html.body:
SnapshotWaiter
A snapshot timing manager to wait and fulfillment for the scenario
content to be rendered.
public final class SnapshotWaiter

Initializers
init()
Initialize a new waiter.
public init()

Properties
isWaiting
Specifies whether currently waiting.
